Description of incident: "On July 22, 2016, Eastwood learned that malicious software code may have been inserted into its e-commerce website.  We immediately removed the malicious software, began an investigation and hired a third-party cyber-security firm to assist us.  Findings from the investigation show that if a customer placed an order on our website from May 29, 2016 to July 22, 2016, information associated with the order being placed may have been obtained by an unauthorized third-party."The information compromised included names, addresses, phone numbers, email addresses, payment card numbers, expiration date and security code.The Information: https://oag.ca.gov/ecrime/databreach/reports/sb24-64455
